com.whirvis.jraknet.windows

Class UniversalWindowsProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.whirvis.jraknet.windows.UniversalWindowsProgram

  • public class UniversalWindowsProgram
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a universal Windows program. This is mainly meant to be used to give universal Windows programs loopback exemption so users can connect to JRakNet servers on the same machine. This class can safely be used on other machines that are not running on the Windows 10 operating system (and is actually encouraged if the game exists as a universal Windows program on Windows, such as Minecraft) without risking crashes due to incompatibilities. However, if the machine is not running Windows 10 then this class is guaranteed to behave differently (code intentionally not running, intentionally giving different results, etc.)
    Author:
    Whirvis T. Wheatley

      • isWindows10

        public static final boolean isWindows10()

        Returns:

      • addLoopbackExempt

        public boolean addLoopbackExempt()
        Makes the application loopback exempt, allowing it to connect with applications on the same machine.
        Returns:
        true if the application was successfully made exempt, false otherwise.

      • deleteLoopbackExempt

        public boolean deleteLoopbackExempt()
        Makes the application loopback unexempt, preventing it from connecting with applications on the same machine.
        Returns:
        true if the application was successfully made unexempt, false otherwise.
